job_title: Licensed Mental Health Clinician in Atlanta, GA
pros: It's a fulfilling job to work with diversity (both in patients and coworkers). It can be fast-paced, interesting, and you see similar things presented differently being a Level 1 Trauma hospital. Certainly great for growing in the initial part of your career (working at Grady means you can handle tough days) and plenty of people stay for years at Grady because of how dynamic it is and how it pays just a bit more than its competitors.
cons: Since you see everyone, you will see the good and bad. Patient safety is important, but staff safety is important as well. The frustrating thing about the place is that politics take over and things that are ultimately important (delivery of quality healthcare to patients, and caring about your employees well-being not just by lip service) are neglected. Workplace violence is a thing, and honestly healthcare providers should not have to accept being attacked by patients as a part of a job. Also, I remember trying to negotiate my salary, and the HR employee was certainly not having it that day.

pros: -every call is different -working remote

pros:
-Full time schedule is nice, with two days on, two days off, and working every other weekend, 12 hour shifts. 
-It is easy to bond with coworkers and people are generally supportive of new employees.
cons:
-We are chronically understaffed, which means we often have to stay over at least 2 hours. 
-The stress of listening to people in such dire situations is indescribable and can be difficult to cope with. 
- We have issues with frequent callers in non-emergency situations, which can lead to extreme wait times for them, and frustration for us.

pros: With all the drawback of working in an inner-city, teaching hospital, the healthcare experience gained at Grady is invaluable.  The complexities of the medical problems presents challenges to any discipline that would prepare one to work anywhere in the world.  The minimal resources available to care for indigent patients, often with multi-system organ failure will stir creativity in the creative, the social injustice witnessed first hand will stir the passion in the passionate, and  with develop initiative and ingenuity in the young and inexperienced. I recommend at least one year of experience at Grady for anyone entering the healthcare field in any discipline.
cons: For the level of commitment necessary to be effective at Grady, the compensation is poor.  Many people who love Grady leave for better paying jobs.  Often the people left are those that don't care, contributing to the poor reputation Grady suffers.  That same level of commitment also leads to burnout for those who choose to stay despite the poor pay.

pros: The amount of learning and education opportunities is endless
cons: Learning the hospital because of its size

pros: Challenging position that allows for growth
cons: There are no cons to the job

review_title: Great Learning Environment, team effort, hard work,
pros: LOTS of opportunities to learn real nursing.  High level of acuity in all departments, bring a positive "can do" attitude and you will have lots of help from other nurses.  Everything isn't perfect all the time so you learn how to adapt and really critically think.  I personally have loved every nurse that I have worked with so far.  They are extremely positive and encouraging to new graduates.  Ask for help, don't mess up first and then ask for someone to clean up your mess.
cons: The hospital is in overflow status all of the time.  Every single bed is always full, so expect 30 min after your discharge, you are going to get an admission.  Plan accordingly!

review_title: Approach with Caution - Weigh Other Options Before Accepting Their Offer
pros: Grady Health System has an incredible mission and affect on the larger community and does important work on a daily basis. Grady has made strides to improve the level of care provided to patients and potential patients and continues to make news in the Medical world.
cons: Grady does a poor job at administration and maintaining its workforce. Grady suffers from poor leadership at several levels and exercises little respect for its employees who are not nurses. The organization as a whole is significantly behind in the implementation and effective use of technology and its human resources. It's culture breeds work silos, grand standing, territorial type behavior and does not cultivate a team environment. The organization as whole is also very political in nature and as a result focuses more on the politics than being an effective non-profit corporation.

review_title: High turnover rate for behavioral health
pros: Good experience and learned a lot
cons: Behavioral Health is a miserable, stressful environment with an extremely high turnover rate. I know of at least 20 nurses and clinicians who have quit in the last year and not one was offered an exit interview, even after requesting one. The main issue in this department is the incompetent managers. Remember, most people do not leave jobs, they leave bad managers.  I worked on the inpatient unit, which is primarily run by three power hungry nurse managers who were very tightknit and abrasive, moody and had a secretive (paranoid) management style. It was useless to utilize the chain of command because the three managers are friends. There was a lot of favoritism and even family members working together. My manager particularly was very paranoid and she accused me of something I didn’t do, that wouldn’t have been a big deal anyway. When I tried to explain what had happened, she had conjured up all this crazy evidence. I finally just went with it to appease her.  Please do yourself a favor, talk to someone who is currently working here before you waste your time.

pros: Great experience working with the Board of Directors and several "C" level Executives
cons:
I was hired to work in the Executive Office of the President/CEO. This particular position has a very HIGH turnover rate and I was not made aware of this ongoing issue until after the fact. (Over the last five years, since I left, there has been a total of 7 different individuals who worked in this same role and left)
There is no teamwork or collaboration in the Executive Offices among the majority of the individuals that make up the Administrative team. Everyone is out for themselves. The Executive Office working environment is very tense causing very high negative emotions, which brings a lot of unnecessary stress among the Administrative Team.

review_title: I've been working at Grady for 4 years and have had a wonderful experience.
job_title: Medical Laboratory Technologist in Atlanta, GA
pros:
- New and exciting changes and improvements in hospital infrastructure.
- Strong emphasis on organization Vision and Core Values.
- Top notch leadership from senior management since CEO John Haupert came on board in 2011.
- Tremendous improvement in service quality, patient care, and employee engagement in recent years promoted in words and action at all levels of leadership (CEO level to section supervisors).
cons: - Employee compensation is competitive, but the not the greatest for the area.

pros: Competitive pay, diverse environment, excellent experience, helping patients at their worst, providing support to families at their worst.
cons:
Healthcare jobs are in place in order to provide care to the population of sick, traumatized, aging, and helpless...
Let us not lose sight of that! Atlanta needs Grady!!!! If we see faults in the systems in place then we need to advocate for change, not rush to social media and down talk our employer and our facility.

pros: Their was opportunity for advancement , they just receive a new CEO an he just began implementing his new changes .And further more it was a teaching hospital .
cons: Unfortunately, short staffed ,shortage  of medical supplies . Such as tubes ,tourniquet, and needles  . Also lack of patient charting. The lack increase in income when comes to raises and promotions.

pros: We serve the most underserved and underrepresented portion of the population here in Atlanta. Their values are consistent with my own personally and their is always a push to get better at serving the city.
cons: Promotion in-house can be hard to come by, even when it is warranted by hard work and the right qualifications.

review_title: Working at Grady Health Systems was a one of a kind experience that I wouldn't trade for the world.
pros: Training, autonomy, a lott of hands on experience, personal growth, serving an under resourced population, team work.
cons: Lack of professionalism among some of the  staff and management team and "cliquish" culture.

pros: Working in Healthcare to save and change  lives. One of the largest healthcare systems in the South East with some great talent and people who care.
cons: Poor management and communication across the organization. No genuine intent on listening to the voice of employees. High turnover as employees are over worked and undervalued. Management thinks that doing PR campaigns with a few  media/ entertainment celebrities is the solution to boosting morale.

review_title: Great for experience, not so much for long term career.
job_title: Health Information Management Tech in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great learning environment. There was no structure to the area I was assigned to, so I was able to execute tasks that were outside of my job scope. This was great since I was a new graduate and needed experience.
cons: The pay is below industry average and the work load is going to be heavier than normal. The culture is not great. Most employees are uneducated and have tones of experience, so they don't accept new graduates well or promote education well. I felt a sense of a "crabs in the bucket" type of social environment.

pros: Good Insurance, 401k matched up to 5%. Teaching hospital, intelligent and diligent staff, competitive pay
cons: Extremely busy everyday of the week, high percentage of homeless and uninsured, large psychiatric population, unsupportive upper management in the EMS department., high turnover rate, burnout of EMS providers without support or mental health care from the hospital.

review_title: Where is it going now?  More of the same?
pros:
1.  Helping the poor of the region.
2.  A good number of staff are honorable people trying very hard to help.
cons:
1  Lack of financial support by surrounding counties and State caused alot of stress to continual do the job with less money
2.  Lack of accountability for those who could pay but did not.
3.  There are a number of staff who are paid well for the industry and yet do not even put in the time or the effort to do their work.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Atlanta, GA
pros: Grady is a very good company to work for. They're very good for the Atlanta metro area, they assist with homeless and they have good benefits and the pay is decent
cons: Grady owns the largest nursing home/ rehabilitation center in the south the pay is decent the benefits are good but the nursing home can't keep enough help most of the time we work short of staff

review_title: Grady Financial Leadership to be replaced!
pros: A very noble cause. We are a Community Hospital that serves the uninsured or under insured and I feel good about helping the people.
cons:
No leadership communication resulting in constant reactive mode. Corrupt financial leaders that have been caught, yet not fired for their unethical behavior. Lack of accountability as senior management just points fingers and lays blame.
Grady Health System needs a clean sweep of all senior leadership.

review_title: If you can make it one year here you can make it anywhere.
pros: It's a teaching hospital.  There is alot to see and learn.  Working with residents can be great sometimes.  There are some great attendings as well.
cons: This hospital is way understaffed.  Forget axillary help like lab, pharmacy, xray, and security because they're pretty much nonexistant.  Walking in and out of work can be dangerous with usually no security in sight.

review_title: Safety net hospital with high aspirations
pros: Well-supported by community (local and state), good services offered, good for community.  Leadership very focused in growth/expansion, number of services offered, and patient satisfaction.
cons: Leadership very focused in growth/expansion, number of services offered, and patient satisfaction without regard for employee satisfaction. Leadership not great at listening to employees when threats or weakness forecasted, even when based on empirical evidence.

pros: In the float pool you get your flexibility by being able to create your own schedule. You're only required to work 36 hrs out of the month. You can be a Unit Clerk, CNA,PCT, Patient Safety Monitor or RN to work in the float pool.
cons: Low paying if you're not an RN. You never know which assignment you're going to get. You're supplemental staffing for the hospital and they send you to areas where you'll be needed the most. Sometimes the patient are combative and you'll have some bad nights if the unit isn't properly staffed.

review_title: Amazing place to grow and get experience
pros: strong group of EMTs and Paramedics in a great hospital based company. Lots of amazing hospital where you can see awesome medicine being performed. You can learn from the best and take this experience anywhere and immediate become an amazing asset at other companies. Having this on my resume made my interview process at my current employment a breeze
cons: very busy, never seem to get off on time, would not recommend someone starting there EMS career (as in very first day on a 911 truck) here as it is very fast paced

pros: Grady is an excellent place to work.  Great experience great work life balance.  Some departments are better than others to work in.
cons: There is not much room for growth in some areas. Grady like to give the better positions to some one on the outside.  Nursing and IT personnel are the only ones able to make a decent salary even if you have a graduate degree.

review_title: In Finance, expect long workdays with no compensation, no accolades, no comp time, ABSOLUTELY NOTHING...!!
pros:
Consultants are highly compensated.
Great co-workers.
Work experience varies based on the department's management.
cons:
Management doesn't expect you to have a life outside of work.
Not allowed to take time off during the 1st of the month but management does.
Mandatory late workdays during closing, but management leaves @ 5 because they "have something to do."
Treats employees like factory workers, clocking in and out for lunch & breaks.
Employees cleans up the mess left behind by high-paid, "expert" consultants.

pros: Benefits, Renovations, culture is gradually changing. Work/Life Balance.
cons: Difficult to move up or over.  No telecommuting opportunities.  No training opportunities.  Decisions are made without including employees.  Punitive environment, employees are scared to make mistakes.  A lot of long term leaders who have an old way of thinking

pros: Great health benefits packages and paid time off accrual
cons: Upper management is completely out of touch with job requirements, there are unrealistic expectations of employees and workloads put on them, extreme micromanagement and use of tracking apps on company devices to watch employees, low pay/compensation, refusal of true and accurate evaluations so employees can receive higher pay raises.

job_title: Senior Staff Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: Feel a sense of wanting to be there, commitment, wide scope and opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge.  Education and career is very well valued.  The patients love coming there for treatments. You as an employee can always be yourself and grow.  The whole execuetive team is very proactive.
cons: Need more pay per performance. They need to increase their pay scale per nurse and be competitive which will come with time.  Managers need more leadership skills and evidence base knowledge.

pros: It is a healthcare system with extreme challenges and there are a lot of learning opportunities for new to healthcare candidates.
cons: Grady has been pushing employee engagement and patient satisfaction for years. However, the corporate culture is very different in action. They misuse Just Culture and have very poor leadership especially in EMS. Don't bother working for Grady, other facilities can give employees equal if not better experience.

job_title: Psychiatric Clinician in Johns Creek, GA
pros: Everything happens at Grady. I am excited every day to go to my work at Grady and provide positive services to improve patients' lives. From my immediate supervisor right up through and including the CEO I am encouraged to do my best work and be my best self. I love my work at Grady.
cons: The air conditioning is difficult to regulate and so sometimes the air gets too warm or too cold. I hope Grady will upgrade the air conditioning.

job_title: Senior Licensed Mental Health Clinician in Atlanta, GA
pros: Serving those that have the least is rewarding. Also company is willing to give market increases on salary every few years to ensure they remain a competitive employer.
cons: Working with those that have very little can be taxing at times and there are limited resources to help meet ongoing needs of the population most served.

pros: Staff were very patient and grateful for the assistance. I felt like I was truly helping and not hindering the staff.  Hospital very clean and professional on the unit I am on. Volunteer jacket provided, Free garage parking & meal voucher every day you volunteer.
cons: The hospital is a little confusing when you are first learning your ways around, BUT ask ANY staff and they are more than eager to point you in the right direction.

job_title: Licensed Mental Health Clinician in Atlanta, GA
pros: Unmatchable exposure to various illnesses in DSM. Autonomy in role. Flexibility in schedule. Ability to work in interdisciplinary setting. Supervision available to associate licensed clinicians.
cons: It can make employees feel vulnerable due to acuity of patients on the unit. Limited resources available to patients. At times, there is a lack of support for frontline employees. Parking is terrible.

review_title: Was treated like a line worker in a factory
job_title: Senior Licensed Mental Health Clinician II in Atlanta, GA
pros: Didn't have to see much of management on 2nd shift, the work was straight forward and it was easy to leave at the end of the shift with no carry-over responsibilities, the pay and benefits were decent
cons: Management.  Management. Management.... did I say management.  It was a worker-slave relationship.  Very degrading.  Getting written up for doing what was professional and ethical.  Dangerous working conditions.

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Atlanta, GA
pros: I loved working here, the people and the cases are awesome!!! excellent environment to learn and grow as a scrub tech. You see all types of cases that you'll probably rarely see elsewhere.
cons: The cons are always the same. Preference cards, flexible hours, SPD/CSS, Call hours, etc are could be improved... but like I said the pros out weigh the cons!!

review_title: Grady EMS was a good job to get your foot in the door for EMS work, but many people burn out after 2 years or so.
pros: Good pay compared to other hospital/EMS companies. Overtime is not an issue. Good experience   and looks good on your resume.
cons: Very strict and political. Youre more a number than a person. "Mandatory" flu shots to get hired and to stay hired. Constantly busy and with the usual frequent flyers.

pros: the reason that Iam applying in this position is that the hospital provide excellent professional service both in the medical area and other health area. Grady hospital is one of the best hospital in atlanta that health staff give you the opportunity to grow in the professional.
cons: Your primary care doctor,the hospital you visit and the various specialist you are sent to are typically part of different organization that do not communicate effectively with one another.

pros: Good pay, good potential. Rewarding opportunity all in all. I would go back there again if I could. The staff is knowledgeable and generally pleasing to work with. Has its exceptions like any big company.
cons: While you were given PTO, it was nearly impossible to get it approved without years of seniority.  Management could be difficult to deal with. Such a big company its easy to get lost in the numbers.

pros: Be ready to work hard and as a team .You will feel good when you get home knowing you have done something for someone who really appreciates it.
cons: poor  nursing management play favorites and" reverse descrimination "Unfortunantely the Peter Principal is sometimes used and it makes it even harder for the great managers.

pros: Great team to work with. We should not have to use PTO to be paid for holidays and some employees should have the option to park on or off site. Some of us do not mind paying for parking.
cons: Some leadership does not know how to professionally talk to people and plays the victim often.

review_title: It has been an experience like no other, incompetent management and lack of respect towards the employees
pros: The population served is the reason alot of people chose Grady as an employer. Also the people whom I work closely with is the reason I've remained at Grady.
cons: The unfairness when it comes to increases and promotions. Management inability to make sound decisions. Non-competitive pay. Employees feel they don't have a voice.

job_title: Staff Nurse, RN in College Park, GA
pros: The staff are very cooperative and willing to go the extra mile for patients and each other.
cons: The nurse to patient ratio, some patients require more medical attention than do others. Nurses can not have 5-6 patients on a Medical/Surgical floor. The medical profession is not a "one size fits ALL"

pros: Love the staff. It is an easy environment to work in. As an intern I've learned key skills that I can apply to future employment
cons: I feel as thought the amount of work the intern is involved in they should offer pay or at least housing assistance

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: Excellent experince with all different cultures-patients and coworkers.  Patient care is great and good teamwork.
cons: A lot of preferential treatment given to certain employees.  Pay is just okay.  No incentive to do your best by management.

review_title: Wonderful Place to Build a Career
pros: Grady provides an exceptional learning environment. It is clear that management is focused on making each employee succeed. They make serving their employees needs and the Atlanta community a top priority! I would highly recommend striving to join the Grady team.
cons: Occasionally there can be some communication issues, but they are swiftly and easily corrected when brought to light.

review_title: I enjoyed working for Grady left due to being offered a job in law enforcement.
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great experience, you're constantly busy, and you'll get a lot of certifications. The group of people you'll work with are great for the most part.
cons: Very very understaffed department. They really can only hire you as PRN due to being so far into overtime which means no benefits, pto, etc.

pros: At Grady, people from various nations and cultures come together everyday for the good of others.  Grady is definitely the place to go if you experience trauma.
cons: It is challenging for some members of the staff to recognize the true value of all team members.

pros: Easy to schedule shifts as PRN. Management seems to care about your well-being. Great place to gain experience. CEO is doing a great job bringing Grady away from negative stereotype.
cons: Staff is a little short, so it is always busy. Taking shift differentials away from EMS PRNs is not really fair when PRNs in other departments still get them.

pros: When i worked as a Unit Clerk at Grady Memorial Hospital i learned customer service experience, team player, critical and analytic thinking, answering and directing calls, arranging transportation for patients, taking minutes in meeting, ordering supplies for patient care.
cons: The only con was my schedule because I had to work 12 hour shifts and go to school at the same time.

pros: Will get opportunity to learn alot.  Hard to get terminated.  Most of the employees are friendly and helpful.
cons: Leaders do appreciate those who goes beyond their duties to get things done.  Poor management.

review_title: By far the WORST place I have ever had the displeasure to work
pros: It was a job to pay the bills (barely)
cons: No respect for educated employees, complete incompetence in all levels of management.  Don't expect promotions, working hard gets you nowhere here, and don't speak up!  Unprofessional, lazy, rude coworkers that are never disciplined.

pros: Grady offers great benefits and opportunities for its employees. There are lots of chances to advance from within the company.
cons: There is barely anytime to your self once you get into the Grady system and pay could be a lot better.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: Great place to work although because of it being an inner city facility, the work was hard. Great nursing leadership and educational initiatives for meeting patient care standards and evidence based research protocols/policies.
cons: The pay was never enough for ALL that is required of you.

review_title: Grady has a great mission, great place to learn - poor leadership and employee engagement
pros:
- Satisfaction of working with an organization with a Mission
- Opportunity to Learn new technology and systems
- Fast paced, never boring
cons:
-Lack of support from higher leadership when most needed
-Employee Engagement Dept. is not supportive of first line managers nor provides
-Lack of resources to work efficiently

review_title: Patients and experience wise I enjoyed my time at this Hospital
pros: Director of Imaging and Management Staff are not worth the money paid. Very unfair to certain workers who work harder than others.
cons: Unregistered Technologist as Lead Techs and a teaching facility. How can you be a Clinical Instructor but you can not pass the registry. These Techs are also higher paid Techs.

pros: The benefits are great and such an affordable price.  My entire family is completely covered for a fraction of the cost from previous employers.  Management is so nice and understanding, yet firm in their commitment to make this a top rated job.
cons: Have not found any yet.

pros: Learn skills to be a good emt/medic in a very fast paced high call volume arena. Sink or swim. All the OT you can stand from time to time.
cons: Tough if it is your first ems gig. Low pay for the job but one of the best paying in the city.

pros: Great company to work for with good benefits to allow for growth with in the company. Make sure to utilize your flex spending account.
cons: There are not a lot of cons working for the company. Try to make sure you plan effective vacation leave to ensure you get the time that you desire.

pros: close to home, free parking,
cons: a culture of indolence pervades. For myself as a circulating OR nurse, i didn't have the proper facility, equipment, supplies, information or resources to perform my job satisfactorily. Management was indifferent to the struggles of the staff to perform their required duties. The "Grady way" then a shrug of the shoulders! WORST workplace I ever had in 20+ years of nursing. Stay Away !!!!!

pros:
Benefits kick in on your first day
MOST of the staff are down to earth 
If you want to pursue a career in the medical field this is a GREAT place to start
cons:
Pay can be better
Its a public hospital so youre going to run into A LOT of drama
Restaurants in the area are limited

pros: Very convenient for college students or people who need to work overnight. The schedule is flexible. You can make your own schedule.
cons: You don’t get any benefits as far as vacation, insurance, PTO, Tuition Assistance, etc unless you’re part time or full time. You won’t received any retirement benefits either.

pros:
Diversity in staff and patients
Diversity in cases
Benefits
cons:
Patient Volume can be hight at times
Tight spaces can be limiting in transporting patients
Limited Resources 
Dirty floors

review_title: Challenging, but you always have a team around you to help you figure it out.
pros: The experience,professional growth/ development, equipment is getting better
cons: Lack of staff to support work load.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Atlanta, GA
pros: I'm only going to type here because I have to.
cons: There is no room for growth. If you want a mindless job where you can do the least possible work, by all means, go ahead. But if you're looking to grow, establish a career and to flourish, avoid this place at all costs.

review_title: Learning experience and fabulous place to work
pros: As the premier level one trauma center, we save lives daily. Marketing department has done a great job of promoting Grady in the community and telling the story.
cons: Grady will sometimes take advantage of you going above and beyond...lots of long hours.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: Learn alot as a new grad or a nurse without level 1 trauma experience.
cons: Administration underwent some changes which may be considered a step backwards in some ways.

pros: I have been at Grady for ten years and it is changing for the better. They really are making an effort to conect, engage, and show appreciation.
cons: People with negative attitudes make it hard at times.

job_title: Materials Management Systems Analyst in Marietta, GA
pros: Lots of opportunities for improvement. Baby steps being made towards efficiency and curbing waste.
cons: Not all embrace the culture of change. A lot of complacency.

job_title: Decision Support and Performance Improvement Analyst in Atlanta, GA
pros:
I was given complete freedom over my projects.
Got few but great mentoring sessions
Learned how to get maximum results using minimum resources.
cons:
It is very challenging to get buy-in from management and the lowest level employees.
Lack of a robust corporate culture

review_title: Hard work but in the long run it is worth it.
pros: It is a good place to work and it is well recognized company to work for.
cons: Hard work for little money depending on the position.

pros: Great company to work  for, Ask question about work if you don't understand.. Ask management when in doubt.. Take notes, write instruction  step by step,
cons: Only con I  have is you have to use your PTO for holiday pay.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: Grady has the city best trauma center. If you are involved in a trauma Grady is where you want to be taken.  People who work at Grady are friendly and knowledgeable.
cons: Things move slowly. Sometimes things are not as organized as they should be.

pros: You will learn alot. Always opportunity to see new things.
cons: always short-staffed. The job feels very hard when it is always short-staffed.

review_title: Stressful at times but very organized system in place
pros: Best of the best work here. The cases one gets in Atlanta are no joke and to work at Grady you have to be ready for anything.
cons: Strict environment but with some obvious favoritism to some people

review_title: Senior leadership is working hard to positively impact the organization's culture.
pros: Commitment of senior leadership, attention on employee engagement and patient safety.
cons: Passive aggressive attitude of some staff, incredible amount of checking and rechecking without accountability.

job_title: Systems Status Controller in Atlanta, GA
pros: Never a dull moment, love my flexible schedule
cons: Benefits could be better. There is no separation between sick time and paid time off... Also, they are very expensive, and the packages got worse this year i terms of what they offer

job_title: Executive Director of Care Management in Atlanta, GA
pros: The mission, the leading edge procedures/technologies, the population Grady serves, and the employees make it so special.
cons: The location is challenging. Parts of the building are very old and unattractive. Other area are absolutely stunning as they have been updated.

review_title: Grady is a great place to work, can be stressful or overwhelming at times.
pros: Grady is an amazing place to work, it's a teaching hospital so majority of the employees are willing to teach and share their knowledge.
cons: It can be a stressful environment.

review_title: The few years that I worked at Grady was pretty decent, as working there allowed me to finish school.
pros: Great for work-life balance and a great learning experience
cons: Annual raises are not all that great and BCBS for insurance suck

review_title: It was very hands on and a great learning experience.
pros: Very good teaching school and hands on approach
cons: There is no room for growth as you grow with the company.

pros: The best hospital to work for you're right in the city of Atlanta and close to everything! Good coworkers and never a dull day at Grady, it's always something new to learn and experience.
cons: The salary needs to be increased

pros: The best coworkers in the world.
cons: The flip side is management has their favorites.  You can get penalised more if you are not in the favorite group.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Stone Mountain, GA
pros: A lot of overtime; Good pay; Vacation whenever you want, if approved.
cons: High turn over, poor management, revolving door when it comes to employees and management; Pay increases/increments are terrible.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Grady is good please to work,  it is like a learning center,  they work as team, collaborate and work in real time for real results.
cons: I think they are doing their best , like other facility

job_title: Senior Licensed Mental Health Clinician-PRN in Tucker, GA
pros:
Overall organization is well run (significant improvements in the last few years under new CEO)
Responsive manager - listens to concerns
cons: Some old world attitudes still exist and can be challenging to work with

review_title: student nurse in CCU, ICU, MICU and SICU
pros: The nurses and PCT's are amazing.
cons: Management doesn't like to pitch in to help their nurses.

review_title: review for position as a registered nurse with grady memorial hospital
pros: regarding patient population, level 1 trauma center.
cons: horrible overall experience. completely unorganized. no communication. could never get anything taken care of

review_title: Overworked with mandatory overtime in one of the busiest 911 systems
pros:
Exceptional PTO (starting at 5 weeks/year)
Very good base pay relative to industry
cons:
Mandatory overtime for full time employees
Enormous workload in a severely understaffed environment
Severe physical demands

pros: Determined the need or our client
cons: the relationship between company and client

pros: The work load is demanding and the experience you gain is invaluable!
cons: Nonstop and a lot of the calls are frequent flyers.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: Exciting and never a dull moment. Unlimited learning potential.
cons: Poor Management Policies and the Establishment Organization is very poor.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Atlanta, GA
pros: The Senior Leadership in the hospital. Very responsive to staff concerns. Quarterly meetings for the entire hospital regarding the hospital from the CEO and COO.
cons: Sometimes the ED leadership (directors)  is all about their friends.

pros: Super easy, no supervision, unlimited overtime
cons: Management doesn’t care. Low pay, low raises, employees who been there 10 years or more runs the department.

pros: You see a wide variety of critical patients as it is a Level 1 trauma hospital in Downtown Atlanta
cons: There is never enough staffing and you can feel burnt out

job_title: Senior Applications Analyst in Atlanta, GA
pros:
Work life balance for IT is pretty good. 
Lots of projects , solid outlook
cons: Projects sometimes have competing priorities, you have to be flexible.

pros: excellent trauma center,  wonderful team work, great work experience, excellent teaching facility, longevity of employees, care for patients, pt. services are excellent.
cons: always short staffed, low wages, no incentives for employees,

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Atlanta, GA
pros: Flexible schedule, the ability to swap shifts with co-workers, plenty of overtime
cons: Management can be a pain sometimes, autonomy lacks at times, work every other weekend.

review_title: A great first job fresh out of school to garner experience
pros: The environment provides so much for you to learn
cons: It is so large that it doesn't really have a culture

job_title: Neurology Social Services Coordinator/Medical/Clinical Social Worker in Lithonia, GA
pros: Excellent Place to work for Clinical Experience!
cons: Very Intense Work.  A good percentage of Uninsured Patients with little resources are seen there.

job_title: RN With Certification in Atlanta, GA
pros: You'll encounter a wide range of clinical diagnoses, excellent products and supplies units and grateful patients.  Very nice ED areas, pre-op, PACU and ICU's,
cons: Teamwork on patient units variable, chronic staffing shortages, team spirit variable.

pros: Depending on the severity of need attention, great care on certain units.
cons: Support staff is payed little attention of gratitude of their value.

review_title: Great learning health system, poor management
job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: Pto, paid sick time, benefits, tuition reimbursement
cons: Poor management, no support for non leadership staff

pros: Descent pay. There are differentials for nights/weekends, but they don't apply to part-time staff. Not much for opportunity advancement.
cons: High call volume, difficult getting off on time, management can be hit or miss.

job_title: Health Information Tech in Atlanta, GA
pros: Grady Healthcare System is a good learning experience.
cons: You have to stay on a positive level, and don't get caught up with the negative people.

pros: The pay is great,and I miss my former Co workers
cons: Leadership needs more training and humility

pros: Salary and Benefits are very competitive.
cons: Some areas are short staffed, so that puts more responsibility on certain individuals.

review_title: It's been a good experience, quite profitable
pros: Very little staff cut backs.
cons: In the heart of the ATL, commute is horrible.

job_title: Critical Care and Dialysis Nurse in Atlanta, GA
pros: experience, work schedule, Computerized charting, team work, Great ceu, and computer-base learning, great epi learning personnel
cons: low pay, poor upgrade in status opportunity, high patient-nurse ratio, management issues

review_title: Able to move up the ladder
pros: Management does not discriminate in giving promotions.  Many educated professionals, role models.  Easy to transfer to different depts.
cons: Some of the employees are unprofessional.

job_title: Financial Counselor in Brookhaven, DeKalb, GA
pros: Always something exciting happening. Plenty of opportunities for growth. Most department leaders care about their employees.
cons: Cafeteria food is expensive lol

pros: So far, mananagement has been phenomenal. The staff seem nice for now, and the work environment is not as stern.
cons: I cannot think of any cons at this time.

pros: Great Insurance, 401k matching, good hours
